definition: to read intensively
to eat till full/satisfied
to read/to study/reading of word (i.e. pronunciation), similar to 拼音[pin1 yin1]
comma/phrase marked by pause

sentences.english: Steeped in economic theory, you might think that demand now declined.
sentences.chinese: 假如你饱读经济理论，可能会认为需求现在会下降了。

sentences.english: ShenHu about Xiao Hui full read now, not only has a powerful military figure.
sentences.chinese: 申虎说起萧辉不仅饱读诗书，还有很厉害的军事图。

definition: to read and re-read sth until one is familiar with it
learned/erudite/scholarly
holy book
full of political wisdom (idiom)/politically astute/with encyclopedic experience of state policy
of great erudition and scholarship (idiom)
conversant with things past and present/erudite and informed
an outstanding talent (idiom)/surpassing insight and acumen
erudite and multi-talented (idiom); versatile and able
erudite/widely read and knowledgeable
proficient (in sth)/to understand sth through and through
lit. always with a book in hand (idiom)/fig. (of a student or scholar) diligent and hardworking
the Book of Songs 詩經|诗经[Shi1 jing1] and the Book of History 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]
scholar/intellectual
experienced scholar/old expert in the field
a book on the art of war
of great talent (idiom)
